body:
I almost think trying to find both files (first exe, after that without extension) would be more reliable (and ofc easier).

Also keep in mind that we explicitly don't support cross-compilation yet, so no promises that a fix for this will make it into V1 stable :)

> I almost think trying to find both files (first exe, after that without extension) would be more reliable (and ofc easier).

Indeed! Do you want me to work on a small patch? I'm not sure to have all the necessary knowledge about the builder's workflow, but I can try üëç

> Also keep in mind that we explicitly don't support cross-compilation yet, so no promises that a fix for this will make it into V1 stable :)

This wouldn't be "explicit cross-compilation support", it would be more like _"making it easier for nerdies trying edge-case cross-compilation"_, and since it shouldn't (and musn't) have any impact on the project, I guess it's fine üòá

> it would be more like¬†"making it easier for nerdies trying edge-case cross-compilation"

Which is pretty much what I meant. Our (human) resources are scarce and since it blocks only something we explicitly don't support (aka spend much time on) we make no promises that it will make it into vs. Especially since we need to make sure that it doesn't break anything (tbf that would be really weird for such a simple change).

That said "no promises" does _not_ mean that it can't make it into it, especially if someone opens a PR for it. (Also on a side note, have in mind that we always have to make sure to not invalidate the audit)

> Do you want me to work on a patch?

Sure why not ‚ù§Ô∏è Can't hurt if you got the time.

Note that there's some shared logic with sidecar (external) binaries as well, might even be reusable code that can be plugged in. IIRC we use target triple to choose input file on those. There's some benefit in terms of total system complexity if input filename is deterministic. To me, it sounds like assuming input filename from current OS is just a plain old bug. Just my 2c.

> it would be more like "making it easier for nerdies trying edge-case cross-compilation"

+1 on this. One positive of this approach is that if/when we want explicit support, we have a head start with a set of known issues from exactly (us) nerdies :)

rename.from: [feat/bug] Take target triple in account for filename instead of OS config
rename.to: [feat] Use configured target triple for filename

issue.title: [bug] When cross compiling to windows the build script fails to rename the target binary.

labels.name: status: invalid
labels.description: This is not a valid issue

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Trying to cross compile to windows (x86_64-pc-windows-gnu) from Linux the compilation successes but it tries to rename the resulting binary but because it has a `.exe` extension and the build script doesn't know that it fails.

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

```
### Other build output...

Error running CLI: failed to rename `/pathtoproject/target/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/release/app` to `/pathtoproject/target/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/release/rift-desktop`: No such file or directory (os error 2)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

### Platform and versions

```shell
Environment
  ‚Ä∫ OS: Arch Linux Rolling Release X64
  ‚Ä∫ Node.js: 17.9.0
  ‚Ä∫ npm: 8.5.5
  ‚Ä∫ pnpm: 7.0.0-rc.9
  ‚Ä∫ yarn: 1.22.18
  ‚Ä∫ rustup: 1.24.3
  ‚Ä∫ rustc: 1.59.0
  ‚Ä∫ cargo: 1.59.0
  ‚Ä∫ Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu 

Packages
  ‚Ä∫ @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.0.0-rc.9
  ‚Ä∫ @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.0.0-rc.4
  ‚Ä∫ tauri [RUST]: 1.0.0-rc.8,
  ‚Ä∫ tauri-build [RUST]: 1.0.0-rc.7,
  ‚Ä∫ tao [RUST]: 0.8.3,
  ‚Ä∫ wry [RUST]: 0.15.1,

App
  ‚Ä∫ build-type: bundle
  ‚Ä∫ CSP: unset
  ‚Ä∫ distDir: ../dist
  ‚Ä∫ devPath: http://localhost:3000/
  ‚Ä∫ framework: Svelte

App directory structure
  ‚îú‚îÄ src
  ‚îú‚îÄ public
  ‚îú‚îÄ .vscode
  ‚îú‚îÄ src-tauri
  ‚îú‚îÄ .idea
  ‚îú‚îÄ dist
  ‚îî‚îÄ node_modules
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

body: The CLI is not designed for cross compilation at all (even the WiX bundling will fail). The rename issue is the easier to fix though.

> There's some benefit in terms of total system complexity if input filename is deterministic.

Something like `if target_triple matches "windows"` would still be deterministic IMO.

> The CLI is not designed for cross compilation at all (even the WiX bundling will fail). The rename issue is the easier to fix though.

That's the main and sole point of this issue! Because a successful cross-compilation would be (hopefully) the only side-effect of such change!

If you're okay, I'll open a PR soon üòâ
Yeah I agree with that approach @Pierstoval

PR opened there: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/4032

I have some questions, if you could check them out when you have enough time and energy üëç

Seems like a new bug was introduced in normal build:

```
$ tauri build
   Compiling csr v0.1.0 (C:\dev\cacs-rg\src-tauri)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 1m 52s
Error: failed to rename `C:\dev\cacs-rg\src-tauri\target\release\csr..exe` to `C:\dev\cacs-rg\src-tauri\target\release\csr..exe`

Caused by:
    Le fichier sp√©cifi√© est introuvable. (os error 2)
```

Will try to provide a fix this afternoon üòÖ

issue.title: Append binary extension to filename based on target in Settings

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
This is a followup of #4032 and #4055, for the issue #3870.

I'm still attempting to cross-compile using `cross`, and I don't know if this specific change will break compat, so I'm creating this PR so that CI tests it on several other tools :)
